title: Correlative XPS Analysis of a Novel Material System Generated Using a Combinatorial Approach
content: Combinatorial techniques, involving the simultaneous synthesis of multiple samples for rapid characterization, have been instrumental in discovering new material phases and exploring compositional and structural properties in complex systems. Examples include perovskite solar cells, ferromagnetic semiconductors, and shape memory alloys. The integration of combinatorial methods with X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) allows for a comprehensive analysis of surface structure, offering insights into distributions and chemistries.
